snippet.title: Rich man, I am: Yoda fan wins $425M Powerball prize
snippet.description:
* You and I got pranked on April Fools' Day. B. Raymond Buxton got paid.
http://www.cnn.com/2014/04/01/us/powerball-lottery-winner/index.html

snippet.title: Fracking at the palace, One Direction haircuts and U.N. peacekeepers in Scotland: April Fool's Day round-up
snippet.description:
* It's that time of year again: You can't open a paper or click online without being subjected to April Foolery, from hard-to-swallow hoaxes to nearly-believable news.
http://www.cnn.com/2014/04/01/world/europe/april-fool-round-up-2014/index.html

snippet.title: Pranks a lot, April Fools' Day food jokesters
snippet.description:
* Kate Krader (@kkrader on Twitter) is Food & Wine's restaurant editor. When she tells us where to find our culinary...
http://eatocracy.cnn.com/2014/04/01/april-fools-food-pranks/

snippet.title: Rescuers paint harrowing portrait of search aboard sunken ferry
snippet.description:
* In the final, chaotic moments before the South Korean ferry Sewol rolled over and sank into the chilly waters of the Yellow Sea, 48 girls obeyed the orders of crew members and put on their life vests.
http://www.cnn.com/2014/04/25/world/asia/south-korea-ship-sinking/index.html

snippet.title: The Internet's best April Fools gags
snippet.description:
* A new digital map helps you find the Pokemon among us. YouTube made a shocking confession, Samsung and HTC advanced the world of wearable tech with souped-up gloves and you'll never have to take another lonely selfie, thanks to The Hoff.
http://www.cnn.com/2014/04/01/tech/web/web-april-fools/index.html

snippet.title: Ted Cruz's fake tattoo and other April Fools’ pranks
snippet.description:
* (CNN) - Sen. Ted Cruz rolled up his sleeve Tuesday to show off his new "tattoo." The inked up arm was one of a number of April Fools’ pranks that played out in the political world. For Cruz's part, the Texas Republican was doing an interview on "Fox...
http://politicalticker.blogs.cnn.com/2014/04/01/ted-cruzs-fake-tattoo-and-other-april-fools-pranks/

snippet.title: Neil Patrick Harris, as Hedwig, curses at fan
snippet.description:
* Neil Patrick Harris isn't a foul-mouthed rocker -- he just plays one on Broadway -- but he's had some people fooled.
http://www.cnn.com/2014/04/21/showbiz/celebrity-news-gossip/neil-patrick-harris-hedwig/index.html

snippet.title: A totally new kind of golf, dude
snippet.description:
* George Plimpton, in the 1973 nonfiction book "Mad Ducks and Bears," describes a charity golf tournament. One of its organizers was Alex Karras, a pro football player with a sense of humor every bit as absurd as his big scene in the Mel Brooks cowboy spoof "Blazing Saddles," in which Karras' character, Mongo, punches a horse.
http://www.cnn.com/2014/04/24/opinion/downey-future-of-golf/index.html
